DOC.brief_summary: This study examines the efficacy of haldol versus risperdal in the treatment of aggression in psychotic prison inmates. It is hypothsized that risperdal will be more effective in decreasing aggression than haldol.
DOC.brief_title: Haloperidol vs. Risperidone in the Treatment of Aggression in Psychotic Inmates
DOC.criteria: age 18 or over, psychotic disorder diagnosed on SCID, inmate at correctional facility for at least 2 weeks active withdrawal from substances of abuse, nonpsychotic individuals, pregnant women, people unable to give informed consent, patients on mood stabilizers
